title: Refund a myki or ticket
summary: You can also replace a myki, paper ticket or student ID , including transferring the balance.

title: New readers, same myki
summary: Following a successful public trial of myki payments on new ticket readers, we have begun progressively installing new ticket readers across the rail network, line-by-line.

title: Replace a myki, ticket or student ID
summary: Replace a myki, travel pass, ticket or student ID, including expired mykis. In most cases, you can also transfer the balance.

faqs.question: Got questions?
faqs.answer: You can make a public transport enquiry , or use our myki feedback form .

title: myki Money and myki Pass
summary: Pay as you go with myki Money, or buy consecutive days with a myki Pass.

title: Auto Top Up
summary: Choose a minimum myki Money balance and set a recurring myki top up amount.

title: myki types
summary: Choose the myki that best suits your eligibility and travel requirements.

title: Extend an expiring myki
summary: If your myki is nearing its expiry day, scan it before tapping on to travel.

title: Top up your myki
summary: Use a range of physical and online options to top up your myki.

title: Your ticket to travel
summary: Use myki on trains, trams and buses in Melbourne, and some parts of regional Victoria.

title: myki is getting an upgrade
summary: Victorians can look forward to convenient new ways to pay for public transport, including with credit or debit cards, smartphones and smart devices.

title: Register your myki
summary: Protect your account balance and set up Auto Top Up with a registered myki

title: Public transport ticketing help
summary: Detailed help articles on topics including finding your myki username or password, refunds and replacements, and registering your myki.

title: Sleeping transactions
summary: Topped up online more than 30 days ago and haven’t tapped on? Your myki Money top up, Auto Top Up or myki Pass is sleeping.

title: Fares
summary: View the cost of train, tram and bus trips in metropolitan Melbourne.

title: Free travel myki
summary: You may be eligible for one of the free travel passes, which offer free public transport, all the time.

title: Metropolitan train, tram and bus fares
summary: View the cost of train, tram and bus trips in metropolitan Melbourne.

title: Tickets and myki
summary: Learn how to buy and use a ticket on the public transport network. View information on fares and public transport zones.

title: Regional bus fares
summary: Fares are based on myki zones, or ‘charging units’ for paper tickets.

title: Regional train fares
summary: Fares are based on myki zones, or ‘charging units’ for paper tickets.

title: Cheaper travel with myki
summary: Travellers using a myki card can take advantage of cheaper fares at certain times, and other discounted-travel initiatives.

title: Concession myki
summary: Check if you meet the eligibility rules below. You may be fined if you don’t follow the rules.

title: Child myki
summary: Children 4 and under can travel free, without a myki. Older children can use a half-price child myki.

title: myki Commuter Club
summary: Buy discounted 365 day myki Passes for your organisation’s employees through the myki Commuter Club program.

faqs.question: Already a member of the club?
faqs.answer: Manage your myki by setting up a myki accoun t. Click on ‘Create an account’ and ‘I already have a myki’ and follow the prompts.

title: Students
summary: Many full-time students can get discounted public transport fares. Follow the rules on this page based on your student type.

title: Mobile myki
summary: Pay for public transport fares using a digital myki on your Android phone.

title: Full Fare myki
summary: All travellers aged five and older need a myki to travel on most trains, trams and buses in the myki zone.

title: myki machine top up
summary: Use myki machines to top up your myki Money or myki Pass balance.

title: Buy a myki card
summary: Buy a myki card so you can use it on public transport in Victoria.

title: Instant top up on the PTV App
summary: Top up your myki Money balance instantly using the PTV App on your smartphone.

title: Quick top up machine
summary: myki quick top up machines are a fast and easy way to top up your myki balance.

title: Top up in person
summary: the PTV Hub in Southern Cross Station (on the concourse near the corner of Spencer Street and Collins Street)

title: Tap on and off with myki
summary: Ensure you get the lowest fare, charged the same day you travel.

title: myki is getting an upgrade - Simplified Chinese
summary: JavaScript must be enabled to use this site. We're sorry for any inconvenience.

title: myki is getting an upgrade - Vietnamese
summary: JavaScript must be enabled to use this site. We're sorry for any inconvenience.

title: Find a myki outlet near you
summary: You can use the website or PTV App to find myki outlets nearby.

title: myki equipment
summary: ​How to use myki machines, Quick Top Up machines, readers and gates.

title: International Student Travel Pass troubleshooting
summary: Find out what to do if you're having problems with your International Student Travel Pass.

title: Find your myki password
summary: Use your device's password manager to find and use your myki login and password.

title: Paper tickets and eTickets
summary: You need a paper ticket or eTicket to travel on some regional train, bus and coach services.

title: Other ticket types
summary: Apply for free travel vouchers, group travel, special event ticketing or an animal assistance pass.

title: Group travel
summary: Get cheaper public transport fares when travelling with 12 or more people.

title: Free travel vouchers
summary: Eligible travellers can register to get yearly free travel vouchers.
